name: Hilton Garden Inn Seattle/Renton

reviews.text: I'll start my review as I do all my other ones. I'm a regular business traveler, traveling 2 to 3 days, about 80% of the year. So if you want to call me a road warrior that's fine.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service & Hotel

reviews.text: I'm trying to be really good about writing reviews on the hotels/restaurants I find in my travels that are great and deserve the recognition. I'm also trying to especially let you know about the places that drop the ball and provide poor customer service, etc.
reviews.title: Clean, Well-maintained, In a quiet area, Comfortable beds, Top-notch staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also consider myself well versed on what exceptional customer service is all about since I have professionally taught that topic in many seminars throughout the country. That's why I'm always excited to share with you when I find those organizations that truly get what exceptional customer service is all about.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at The Renton Hilton Garden Inn on June 6th. Checking in was exceptional. There were three exceptional employees at the front desk. Unfortunately I only got one of the three names--that was Katlin. Katlin and her colleagues were fantastic. Super friendly, made you feel welcome and willing to bend over backwards to provide great service.
reviews.title: Room fine, service adequate

reviews.text: The hotel itself is fantastic. Clean, comfortable and great quality. In my travels if I had a choice I would stay at a Hilton Garden Inn over a regular Hilton. They are dependable, consistent and I haven't been disappointed with one yet. The one in Renton did not disappoint and I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast and friendly check in, booked our airport shuttle right then. Cookies on the counter! Nice decor in the room, good computer work station, no problem getting online. Ergonomic chair by Mirra really comfortable, totally adjustable. Foam mattress (Garden Sleep System) has adjustment dial for firmness. Small fridge and microwave.
reviews.title: New favorite Sea-Tac hotel

reviews.text: We were checking out early so did not try the restaurant. They also offer a Stay Fit Kit if you want to exercise in your room. Good value for a nice property.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Washington State!!!

reviews.text: I had the best stay at Hilton Garden Inn in Renton/Seattle, Washington. The staff was "Excellent" from the GM on down. These people should write the book on Customer Service. There were several amenities that made my 8-day stay the best. The room and bathroom were very clean. The bed was comfortable. Their courtesy van service eliminated the need for us to rent a car; they transported us to and from the airport and anywhere else within five miles of the hotel. I felt safe in the area. The campus was clean and nicely grooomed. I ate twice at the restuarant - the 1/2 pound burger was very tasty. The staff was always cleaning the lobby area; they kept a clean coffee bar; there were always fresh cookies in the evening; the fresh lemon water was not only beautiful but a refreshing treat; I appreciated the free Internet; the workout room was a plus. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.
reviews.title: Mediocre hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights. Upon check-in got 6 breakfast coupons as a H&H Gold member. Breakfast was very average, I have been to other Garden Inn hotels and seen a lot of better ones with far greater variety... surely would not pay for this one. In six days there I was asked just twice if I need anything at the breakfast... I guess coupon people are not great tippers, right? Room with king bed was clean, internet connection free and quite fast, but after two days of stay there I discovered my fridge is not working. Try to find out why and discovered somebody has taken the wires from the electricity... why? Because electricity plug was broken... insted of fixing the damn plug they have just switched the fridge off. Brilliant. I did switch the fridge back, only to discover that this fridge is in fact working so hard that it freezes the food... :) Definetely the big MINUS for the hotel maintenance.
reviews.title: Frustrating and Lame

reviews.text: I'm giving this a Poor rating because since I've been here (12 hours), I've experienced a lot of frustration. After a 6 hour flight from the east coast, I was really happy to arrive. As soon as I got to my non-smoking room, however, I was overwhelmed with the smell of smoke. I think whoever prepared the room must of known this too because the window was wide open and the airconditioner was blasting. I called the desk and politely asked if I could change my room. It was explained to me that there were no more available rooms (totally understandable) and they told me that it was just a smoke smell seeping in from the hallway or a neighboring room. Which was ridiculous since there are ash burn marks on the furniture in the room, proof positive of a smoker in the room , and there was no smoke odor in the hallway. The offered to send up someone to the room to spray air freshener, (cause nothing makes a smoke smell better than combining it with the smell of air freshener.) Finally, they offered me a breakfast voucher which was a good gesture. But I still hate lame excuses that refuse to validate my legitimate complaint. Bad customer service.
reviews.title: A Modern Value!

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights over a weekend. The property met and exceeded all the standards of a HGI. I would return without hesitation.
reviews.title: Much better than average HGI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.text: --quiet setting next to 3 other hotels. Free parking--lots of spaces
reviews.title: Nice, expensive

reviews.text: --wonderful full buffet breakfast, complimentary to Hilton gold and diamond members. The oatment "bar" had 10 toppings available--rarely seen! Cooked to order eggs and all the usual accompaniments. One of the best HGI breakfast I've seen.
reviews.title: Always good

reviews.text: --friendly and helpful staff; hot cookies at front counter each night
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Hotel was very clean. Restaurant was OUTSTANDING. I usually do not eat in most of the restaurants in the hotels that I stay at, but I made an exception on 7-30-11. My dinner was very good - everything was hot and fresh. Breakfast the next morning was busy, but again, very good. I would eat at a Garden Inn restaurant on my next visit.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel after returning from our Alaskan cruise. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Not much to do around the hotel but the hotel shuttle offers rides to a huge indoor mall and/or trolley to get to Downtown/Pike Place. They will even come back and pick you up when you are ready. Overall good relaxing stay at the end of our trip.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Hilton Garden Inn because I knew we'd get a comfortable bed, and the location was great for me because I was traveling throughout Seattle/Eastside/South End.
reviews.title: All in All a good stay

reviews.text: The hotel is right off Hwy 167 so at times we did hear some traffic noise.
reviews.title: Promised bed, never delivered

reviews.text: On the second night I did ask to switch rooms because even though our room was non-smoking (rm 231) it is at the end of the smoking hall and the smell of cigarette smoke was wafting into my room. Yvonne was able to move us to the third floor for the remaining two nights.
reviews.title: A Fine Hilton Garden Inn

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Seattle/Renton Hotel Renton
